newsitem.title: ITALY: Bank of Italy selling up to 1.5 trln lire BOTs.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Italy selling up to 1.5 trln lire BOTs.

text.p: The Bank of Italy said it would sell up to 1.5 trillion lire of February 28, 1997 short term bills (BOT).
Bids must be received by 0800 GMT.
At the last sale of 1.0 trillion lire worth of BOTs on July 5, the maximum rate was 8.93 percent and average rate 8.87 percent.
At its last buyback operation on October 14, the central bank bought 2.5 trillion lire worth of bills at a minimum rate of 7.51 percent and average rate of 7.64 percent.
